plugins.name: Postcard Generator Experiment
plugins.description:
This plugin is a study project for the Generative AI course at the Innopolis University.


It tries it's best to generate greeting cards by combining layout generation, user-uploaded photos, a custom AI-generated poem and a thematic AI-generated background.


To run, get a token at an https://openrouter.ai and place it as the only text block on an empty page.


For help feel free to write me at levada.andrew@gmail.com


Github ‚Äî https://github.com/andrewlevada/postcard-generator-experiment

plugins.name: Little Bro
plugins.description:
Your Personal Design Mentor for Growth, Confidence, and Impact

Little Bro is the ultimate tool for designers who want to elevate their craft and make a real impact. Whether you're a junior designer, freelancer, or aspiring creative, Little Bro provides the mentorship and tools you need to thrive in your design journey.


  1. Instant Feedback on UX and Usability: Get real-time insights into your designs with usability simulations that help you identify pain points and improve user satisfaction.
  2. Accessibility Standards Made Simple: Ensure your designs are inclusive and meet accessibility standards effortlessly, making your work usable for everyone.
  3. Overcome Creative Blocks: Stay inspired and productive with strategies to spark creativity and keep your projects moving forward.
  4. Refine Your Presentation Skills: Learn to articulate your design decisions with clarity and confidence, helping you win over clients, teams, and stakeholders.
  5. Continuous Skill Development: With guidance refined by senior, staff, and director-level UI/UX and product designers, Little Bro helps you grow into the confident, skilled designer you aspire to be.


Little Bro is more than just a tool‚Äîit's your partner in mastering the art of UI/UX. From instant feedback to accessibility and usability insights, Little Bro is here to help you create designs that are not only beautiful but also functional and impactful.


Join a community of designers transforming their careers with Little Bro and unlock your full potential today.

plugins.name: OxyReIcon
plugins.description:
OxyReIcon is the ultimate Figma plugin for designers and icon creators who want to streamline their workflow and create consistent, professional-looking icon sets effortlessly.


Key Features:

  1. Instantly create frames around your vector icons
  2. Customize background and icon colors with opacity control
  3. Automatically align icons in a customizable grid layout
  4. Resize icons and frames with precise control
  5. Convert framed icons back to vectors with a single click
  6. Save and load your preferred settings for quick access


Whether you're creating a comprehensive icon library, designing a cohesive UI, or preparing assets for development handoff, OxyReIcon has got you covered. Say goodbye to manual resizing and positioning ‚Äì let our plugin do the heavy lifting so you can focus on what matters most: designing great icons.
plugins.tagline: Transform your vector icons into perfectly styled, grid-aligned frames in seconds.

plugins.name: Remote Variable Replacer
plugins.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren‚Äôt coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or ‚Äúremote‚Äù, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don‚Äôt seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
plugins.tagline: Replace those pesky remote variables!

135284.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren‚Äôt coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or ‚Äúremote‚Äù, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don‚Äôt seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
135284.release_notes:
Improved the dropdowns for numerical variables to only show local variables whose base value match the remote variable base value. This should make the plugin easy to navigate if a user has hundreds of variables.

Removed beta language; Included network access for tailwind for easy stying and unpkg.com for React. This should fix the blank screen of death. Rookie mistake!

Also updated the data security details to let users know the network access is only for static items.

## English


### Overview

AI Alt Text Generator is a Figma plugin that uses Google Gemini or OpenAI Vision APIs to automatically generate accessible alt text for selected images in your Figma file.


### Features

- Generate alt text using **Gemini (Google) or OpenAI Vision API**

- **UI and prompt language switch (Japanese/English)** with a single button

- **API keys are securely saved** using Figma's clientStorage

- **Generate multiple candidates (1‚Äì5) at once, editable and selectable**

- **Keyword input** to influence the generated alt text

- **Image preview** and status display

- **Clear error feedback**


### Setup

1. Install the plugin in Figma

2. Obtain a [Google Gemini API key](https://aistudio.google.com/apikey) or an [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys)

3. Launch the plugin and enter/save your API key(s) in the Settings tab


### How to Use

1. **Select an image node on the Figma canvas**

2. In the "Generate Alt Text" tab, click the "Analyze Image" button

3. The image preview and size will be displayed

4. Optionally, enter keywords (comma-separated for English, "„ÄÅ" for Japanese) and select the number of candidates

5. Click the "Generate Alt Text" button

6. Candidate alt texts will be displayed, each editable

7. Copy the desired alt text and paste it into Figma's alt text field or elsewhere as needed


### Language Switch

- Use the "Êó•Êú¨Ë™û | English" button at the top right to instantly switch all UI and prompts between Japanese and English


### About API Keys

- Either Gemini or OpenAI API key is required (if both are entered, Gemini is prioritized)

- API keys are securely saved in Figma's clientStorage

- Please check each service's official documentation for free tier and usage limits


### Notes

- This plugin sends the selected image to external AI services (Google Gemini/OpenAI) for analysis. Please be mindful of privacy and confidential information.

- The generated alt text is AI-generated; please review and edit as needed before use.

plugins.name: Pager
plugins.description:
Design-Ready File Templates in Seconds

Stop rebuilding your file structure every time.

Pager helps you spin up clean, structured Figma files with reusable templates built from your own component libraries or ours.


Whether you're starting a new product flow, setting up for research, or handing off to devs, Pager gives you a smart starting point so you can focus on design, not setup.


With Pager, you can:

Import full-page layouts from your published library components


  1. Use default templates for wireframes, UI, research, and more
  2. Create dynamic templates with text, boolean, and variant controls (Pro)
  3. Build faster with consistent, scalable structure


No setup? No problem.

Start from scratch or pick a default template.

Upgrade to Pager Pro anytime to sync your own library and automate your team‚Äôs workflow.


üìö View Documentation

üß© Explore Example Templates

plugins.name: SaveFrame - Save, Share, and Manage Custom Frames with Ease.
plugins.description:
SaveFrame ‚Äî Figma Frames, Re imagined!


Tired of Figma‚Äôs default frame window? SaveFrame is your modern visual command center for everything frames.

Custom frames, Organize, preview, customize, delete, and share‚Äîlike never before.


Whether you're documenting designs, building moodboards, or curating visual systems, SaveFrame gives you full creative control. It's what Figma frames should feel like.


‚ú® Why designers love SaveFrame:


üîç Instant Frame Previews

  1. No more clicking around. See all your frames at a glance in a clean, scrollable UI.

üß© Drag & Drop Organization

  1. Sort, group, and build collections effortlessly. Your canvas, your logic.

üßπ Smart Deletion

  1. Clear out what you don‚Äôt need‚Äîinstantly. Delete single frames or full sets with confidence.

üìê Save All the Details

  1. Dimensions, effects, layout, constraints‚ÄîSaveFrame remembers the stuff that matters.

üé® Reusable Frame Presets

  1. Create your own frame styles and apply them in one click. Keep your design patterns consistent.

üöÄ Seamless Sharing

  1. Export and import frame collections in seconds.
  2. Perfect for sharing with teammates or individuals‚Äîno friction, no confusion.

‚≠ê Favorite Key Frames

  1. Highlight your best work and access it instantly when it counts.

üåó Light & Dark Mode

  1. A workspace that adapts to your vibe, day or night.



üõ† Built for designers who:

  1. Want more control than Figma gives out of the box
  2. Create and manage multiple frames daily
  3. Build moodboards, docs, and design systems
  4. Hate clutter and love visual clarity
  5. Need a fast way to share organized frames with collaborators


In short:

We took the idea of Figma frames and made it flexible, collaborative, and creator-first.

SaveFrame isn‚Äôt just a tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a better way to work with frames.

plugins.name: Sustainalyzer
plugins.description:
Sustainalyzer helps you evaluate the ecological impact of your Figma designs. It detects design elements that conflict with the Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG) and scientific research on digital sustainability.


The plugin checks for the following sustainability issues:


  1. Avoid videos, particularly autoplay or background media
  2. Minimize image use, especially large or excessive images
  3. Optimize images for size, format, and scaling
  4. Avoid third-party services (e.g. embeds, maps, social widgets)
  5. Avoid decorative elements that add visual weight without purpose
  6. Limit font variants to reduce font file size
  7. Prefer system fonts over custom fonts
  8. Reduce complexity by limiting the number of elements
  9. Disable animation autoplay to reduce processor load
  10. Consider older devices, avoiding effects that degrade performance or compatibility
  11. Use a design system to support reuse and reduce redundancy

Each guideline is tagged with an impact level‚Äîhigh, medium, or low‚Äîindicating its potential contribution to emissions. You can filter the results by impact level to focus on the most critical issues.

133118.name: Sustainalyzer
133118.description:
Sustainalyzer helps you evaluate the ecological impact of your Figma designs. It detects design elements that conflict with the Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG) and scientific research on digital sustainability.


The plugin checks for the following sustainability issues:


  1. Avoid videos, particularly autoplay or background media
  2. Minimize image use, especially large or excessive images
  3. Optimize images for size, format, and scaling
  4. Avoid third-party services (e.g. embeds, maps, social widgets)
  5. Avoid decorative elements that add visual weight without purpose
  6. Limit font variants to reduce font file size
  7. Prefer system fonts over custom fonts
  8. Reduce complexity by limiting the number of elements
  9. Disable animation autoplay to reduce processor load
  10. Consider older devices, avoiding effects that degrade performance or compatibility
  11. Use a design system to support reuse and reduce redundancy
  12. Choose energy-efficient colors, especially for large UI areas


Each guideline is tagged with an impact level‚Äîhigh, medium, or low‚Äîindicating its potential contribution to emissions. You can filter the results by impact level to focus on the most critical issues.


To use Sustainalyzer, simply select the elements you want to analyze and run the plugin.

- Removed Linear & Radial gradient from decorative elements check
- Minor bug fixes
133118.tagline: Check your designs for sustainability issues based on the Web Sustainability Guidelines.

plugins.name: Skeema
plugins.description:
What is Skeema?

Skeema is a Figma plugin that integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. It allows frontend developers and designers to access API schemas for specific design components, making it easier to align designs with backend structures and speed up the development process.


How does Skeema work?

It connects your Figma designs to the relevant API documentation. By clicking on a design element, you can instantly view the associated endpoint documentation, eliminating the need to search through long API docs.


Who is Skeema for?

This plugin is designed for frontend and backend developers, and teams who work with API-driven applications. It helps bridge the gap between design and development, making UI-based API integration and collaboration smoother and more efficient.


What are the key benefits of using Skeema?

  1. üöÄ Faster API integration: No more switching between tools. Get API docs directly inside Figma.
  2. üéØ Better accuracy: Ensure your design components match the API structures, reducing development errors.
  3. üë©‚Äçüíª Streamlined collaboration: Designers and developers stay aligned, minimizing back-and-forth communication.


Do I need technical skills to use Skeema?

While Skeema is built with developers in mind, it's intuitive enough for designers to use as well. Its UI is designed to seamlessly integrate into your existing Figma workflow, making it accessible for anyone involved in the design and development process.


What APIs does Skeema support?

Skeema is designed to work with OpenAPI (Swagger) specifications, but it can support a wide range of RESTful APIs. As long as your API has proper documentation, Skeema can link it to your Figma designs.


Is Skeema free?

Skeema offers both a free version with basic features and a premium version with advanced features such as team collaboration, extended API support, and priority access to updates.


Can I use Skeema with my team?

Yes! Skeema is built for collaborative teams. You can easily share API-linked designs with your development team, ensuring that everyone stays on the same page and works with the latest API documentation.
plugins.tagline: Skeema integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. Simply click to view docs.

plugins.name: Offgrid.fm
plugins.description:
Offgrid.fm is a lightweight Figma plugin that quietly monitors your design canvas and alerts you when someone is viewing your work without interacting. Whether you're collaborating on sensitive projects or just want more visibility into your workspace and helps you stay in control.


Key Features:

  1. Real-time detection of inactive observers
  2. Instantly identifies who's viewing your designs
  3. Helps protect your creative privacy and intellectual property
  4. Runs silently in the background without disrupting your workflow


Currently supports the Figma Web App only. *


Ideal for designers handling confidential work, remote teams, and creatives who value situational awareness in collaborative environments.

plugins.name: UIEditor-Exporter
plugins.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

122173.name: UIEditor-Exporter
122173.description:

This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
122173.release_notes:
* UI Editor parentSize values will not exceed three decimal places after the export. 
* Text Node Horizontal Alignment and Vertical Alignment has been improved. A new container Node will be created per Text Node to ensure consistent Position and Alignment.
122173.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor
